column1: Q1. Which of the following industry categories best describes the type of business your company is engaged in?

Q2. As you think about the current business or economic conditions in New York State as compared to six months ago, would you say they are considerably better, a little better, about the same, a little worse, or considerably worse?
Q3. Looking forward from today through next year, that is, the entire 2016 year, how would you describe your expectations for the economy in New York State?
Q4. Now thinking specifically about your industry, how would you describe the current business or economic conditions in New York State as compared with six months ago?
Q5. And looking forward from today through the next year, how would you describe your expectations for your industry here in New York?
Q6. Now thinking specifically about your company, what are your expectations for revenue through the year 2016?  Do you believe your revenue will…?
Q7. Continuing to focus on your company, please think quickly about profitability. Between today and the end of the calendar year 2016 do you expect your profits to…?

Q8. Businesses and the executives that direct them strive to enhance profitability in many ways. Through which of the following strategies do you plan to MOST enhance your company’s profitability over the next year?
Q9. Please indicate which of the following are major areas of concentration for your company now and through 2016.
Q10. Do you intend to invest between today through 2016 in any fixed assets for your company designed to meet growing demand, reduce costs or enhance productivity?
Q11. (If investing in fixed assets) What is the main way you expect to finance those assets?
Q12. Now thinking about the people that work for your company, between today and the end of 2016, do you plan to…?
Q13. Now thinking about other challenges that your company faces, which of the following are you concerned with?
Q14. Which of the challenges you selected are you MOST concerned with?

Q15. Thinking specifically about New York and the relationship between the state government and businesses like yours, overall would you say the government of the State of New York is doing an excellent, good, fair or poor job of creating a business climate in which companies like yours will succeed?
Q16. Of the following, what would you like to see the Governor and Legislature of New York focus on?
Q17. Of those, which SINGLE area would you most like to see the Governor and Legislature focus on?
Q18. How confident are you in the ability of the government of the State of New York to improve the  business climate for businesses like yours here in New York over the next year?  Are you…?

Q19. And thinking about the efforts of the federal government, overall would you say the federal government is doing an excellent, good, fair or poor job of creating a business climate in which companies like yours will succeed?
Q20. How confident are you in the ability of the federal government to improve the business climate for businesses like yours here in New York over the next year?  Are you:

Q21A. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Pass Comprehensive Immigration Reform that both secures the borders and provides a path to citizenship for those already in the United States
Q21B. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Pass a Balanced Budget Constitutional Amendment
Q21C. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Increase Federal Spending on Infrastructure
Q21D. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Reduce the Corporate Income Tax Rates
Q21E. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Reduce the Corporate Income Tax on Overseas Earnings
Q21F. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Increase the federal minimum wage from $7.25 to $10.10 per hour
Q21G. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Increase personal federal income tax rates on those earning over $1 million a year
Q21H. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Increase trade restrictions, like tariffs, on goods imported from foreign countries
Q21I. For each of the following national proposals please indicate whether you support it or oppose it.-Adopt additional free trade agreements with foreign nations
Q22. Thinking specifically about your immediate geographic area, including yours and adjacent counties, is the general business climate…?
Q23. And continuing to consider the local market, are conditions locally improving, staying the same or worsening for businesses in your industry?
Q24. Which of the following industry sectors do you think will have a positive impact on the economic vitality of your geographic area in the next three to five years?
Q25. Of those, which SINGLE industry sector do you think will have the greatest positive impact on the economic vitality of your geographic area in the next three to five years.
Q26A. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Suitable workforce
Q26B. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Consumer confidence
Q26C. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Transportation infrastructure
Q26D. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-As an area where businesses can succeed
Q26E. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-As a place where consumers want to live
Q26F. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Airline service
Q26G. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Taxi/car service
Q26H. How would you rate your local area on each of the following:-Local governmental support for business

Q27. Thinking specifically about health care and the Affordable Care Act (ACA), known as Obamacare, and its impact on your business.  Do you think it is having a…? (2013: Do you expect it to have a positive impact on your business, a negative impact or no real impact?)
Q28A. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Increasing benefits to retain employees
Q28B. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Decreasing benefits to cut costs
Q28C. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Offering defined contribution health insurance
Q28D. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Hiring more part-time employees
Q28E. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Reducing the number of hours current employees work
Q28F. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Terminating benefits for current employees
Q28G. Have you made any of the following adjustments due to the Affordable Care Act?-Terminating benefits for retired employees

Q29. Do you agree more with the supporters of the ACA that the law requires only minor tinkering in order to be successful, or with ACA’s critics that seek to repeal the law and replace it with a better health care system?
Q30A. Increasing the minimum wage to $15 per hour for fast food workers
Q30B. Increasing the minimum wage for all workers to $15 per hour
Q30C. Adopt public (i.e., taxpayer) funding for statewide and state legislative elections
Q30D. Reduce the cost of providing workers' compensation insurance
Q30E. Require that employers provide paid family leave to employees

Now turning to some of the risks that companies face, for each of the following, indicate whether you see it as a very significant risk, a somewhat significant risk, not a very significant risk or not at all a significant risk.
Q31B. Accidents affecting non-employees that you may be liable for
Q31H. Threats to your online reputation
Q31K. Key employee illness or death
Q31L. Issues related to human rights violations including sexual harassment
Q32. Of those risks, which if you had to choose, do you see as the single greatest risk that you worry about?
Accidents affecting non-employees that you may be liable for
Issues related to human rights violations including sexual harassment
Q33A. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Purchased additional insurance
Q33B. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Used services of consultants to plan ways to guard against risks
Q33C. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Added additional employees that work specifically to address risks
Q33D. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Instituted mandatory trainings for employees to protect against risks
Q33E. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Added explanatory materials to policy/procedures manual/materials
Q33F. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Added software designed to address risks
Q33G. Which of the following steps have you taken in the last two years to mitigate any of those risks?-Terminated specific products or services that you deemed to be too risky
Q34. As you consider the risks that you and your business face, do you feel safer today than you did two years ago, less safe or about as safe today as you did two years ago?
Q35. If you had it all to do all over again, considering all factors, would you locate your business in New York or someplace else?
For each of the following challenges that some CEOs have mentioned, indicate how significant an obstacle each is as you consider growing your business at your current location(s) in New York.
Q36A. State and Local Project Approval Process
Not at all a significant obstacle
Q36B. Cost of Complying with State Regulations
Not at all a significant obstacle
Not at all a significant obstacle
Not at all a significant obstacle
Q36E. Cost of State and Local Taxes
Not at all a significant obstacle
Not at all a significant obstacle
